newsitem.title: USA: Oregon executes first prisoner in 34 years.
newsitem.headline: Oregon executes first prisoner in 34 years.

text.p: Oregon carried out its first execution in 34 years on Friday on a man convicted of killing three homeless men he lured off the streets of Portland with promises of work.
Douglas Wright, 56, died by lethal injection after he refused to appeal his sentence further and the Oregon Supreme Court rejected a last-minute effort by a civil rights group to save his life.
Wright was pronounced dead at 12:16 a.m./3:16 a.m. EDT, said Perrin Damon, director of communications for the Oregon Department of Corrections.
An Iowa native, Wright was convicted of the 1991 execution-style slayings of three homeless men, whose bodies were found on the Warm Springs Indian reservation.
He previously had served time for a double-homicide and said he did not want to appeal his death sentence because he deserved to die.
He became the first person executed in Oregon since LeeRoy McGahuey died in the gas chamber in 1962.
